items.title: Liverpool confirm Isak broken ankle, out indefinitely
items.summary: Liverpool striker Alexander Isak will be sidelined indefinitely after undergoing surgery Monday on a broken ankle and fibula.

items.title: Salah scores late winner in Egypt's AFCON opener
items.summary: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah scored a stoppage-time goal to give Egypt a 2-1 win over Zimbabwe to start their Africa Cup of Nations campaign on Monday.

items.title: Sources: Madrid's Endrick heads to Lyon on loan
items.summary: Lyon and Real Madrid agreed on Monday to a six-month loan for striker Endrick, sources told ESPN. The loan does not include an option to make the move permanent.

items.title: 'Milan verscheurt contract Origi (30) anderhalf jaar na laatste profduel'
items.summary: AC Milan neemt per direct afscheid van Divock Origi. De dertigjarige Belg had nog een contract tot het einde van dit seizoen, maar dat is nu in onderling overleg ontbonden, melden diverse Italiaanse media. Origi heeft al anderhalf jaar geen profduel meer gespeeld, maar deed onlangs nog wel mee bij de B-ploeg van Milan.

items.title: Transfer window preview: What do Europe's big clubs need?
items.summary: The transfer window is set to open across Europe in January, so what are the top clubs planning? Who comes in? Who will go?

items.title: WSL transfer preview: Man United, Arsenal need depth; Liverpool need anyone
items.summary: Man United need depth, Arsenal have to lower their average age, while you name it, Liverpool need it. What will the WSL window bring?

items.title: Head coach Rowett sacked by Oxford United
items.summary: Oxford United head coach Gary Rowett is sacked with the club in the Championship relegation zone.

items.title: Tackle Van de Ven levert felle discussie op: 'Ik ben verbijsterd'
items.summary: De tackle van Micky van de Ven op Alexander Isak was voer voor stevige discussies in Engeland. De Nederlander blesseerde Isak ernstig met een stevige charge tijdens Tottenham Hotspur tegen Liverpool zaterdag. Had Van de Ven rood moeten krijgen?

items.title: FIFA test nieuwe technologie om randzaken rond doelpunten te tackelen
items.summary: De FIFA test nieuwe technologie die moet vaststellen of de bal over de lijn is gegaan voordat een doelpunt valt. De zogenoemde Out of Bounds -technologie werd deze maand getest tijdens drie wedstrijden van de Intercontinental Cup in Qatar.

items.title: Financi√´le klapper voor RKC: Altena al na een half jaar verkocht
items.summary: Jordi Altena (22) speelde afgelopen zomer nog bij de amateurs van De Treffers, maar maakt een half jaar na zijn transfer naar RKC Waalwijk alweer een volgende transfer. De rechtsback vertrekt naar de Schotse koploper Hearts.

items.title: Carragher kiest voor Roefs als beste Premier League-keeper
items.summary: Jamie Carragher is erg onder de indruk van Robin Roefs. De Nederlandse doelman speelde een uitstekende eerste seizoenshelft voor Sunderland bij de Premier League-rentree van de club. Carragher had een plekje voor hem in zijn beste elf van het eerste halfjaar.

items.title: Why Hollywood battle could change how you watch sport
items.summary: A multi-billion dollar takeover fight is being played out in Hollywood - and Premier League bosses will be watching on closely.

items.title: Infantino gets his way but countries fear Afcon switch will hit them in the pocket | Ed Aarons
items.summary: Political backbiting has led to accusations Fifa is running the show as tournament switches to four-year cycle It was a decision that took many by surprise, although not those who have been watching closely since February 2020. Members of the Confederation of African Football‚Äôs (Caf) executive committee, along with various other dignitaries including George Weah, the former Ballon d‚ÄôOr winner and president of Liberia at the time, were assembled in Rabat at a seminar to hear Gianni Infantino outline his plan for the development of competitions and infrastructure in African football. As well as improving standards in refereeing and mobilising investment in the continent‚Äôs infrastructure, the president of Fifa floated the prospect of holding its most important tournament, the Africa Cup of Nations, every four years instead of every two and described the current arrangement as ‚Äúuseless‚Äù. The argument ran that it would be more beneficial for countries ‚Äúat the commercial level‚Äù and would help to ‚Äúproject African football to the top of the world‚Äù. ‚ÄúLet us show the world what we can do,‚Äù added Infantino. ‚ÄúThis day is special ‚Äì it‚Äôs the start of a new chapter for African football.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: Zvonimir Boban: ‚ÄòIf I didn‚Äôt do this it would be a betrayal of every value I have lived for‚Äô
items.summary: The Croatia legend on his return to Dinamo Zagreb, his fall out with Uefa and the ‚Äòshameful‚Äô actions of Gianni Infantino An afternoon mist is descending over Maksimir Stadion, enhancing the severity of its dramatic, precipitous angles. In a building across the way, Zvonimir Boban is explaining what brought him back. We are eating squid ink risotto in one corner of a room now configured as Dinamo Zagreb‚Äôs canteen; diagonally opposite is the spot where, fighting through the club‚Äôs youth system, a young arrival from Dalmatia used to sleep. ‚ÄúEmotionally it‚Äôs the biggest story of my life, this one,‚Äù Boban says, memories of this former dormitory leaping into his mind‚Äôs eye. ‚ÄúWhere, if not here?‚Äù He has, in some shape or form, been almost everywhere else. Boban has burned brightly but briefly in each of his various lives as a football administrator. The sport would look different were it not for his influence in senior roles at Fifa and Uefa across the past decade. Almost two years have passed since his high-profile resignation from the latter and there was always the sense Boban, opinionated and deeply principled, had further rungs to climb. Continue reading...

items.title: Key backs McCullum, Stokes to spearhead England's post-Ashes recovery
items.summary: Rob Key insists Brendon McCullum is the best man to continue leading England but admits he does not know what the ECB have planned in the wake of their abject Ashes defeat.

items.title: 'A step ahead' - why Wharton holds key for Palace
items.summary: Adam Wharton holds the key to Crystal Palace enjoying more success and becoming a consistent presence in European football.

items.title: Who could succeed Guardiola at Man City?
items.summary: At least two candidates have already been identified as potential replacements for Pep Guardiola, but who could take over from him at Manchester City?

items.title: F1's most viral moments of 2025!
items.summary: Relive the most viral moments of the 2025 season, including Lewis Hamilton's first Sprint win with Ferrari, Yuki Tsunoda's horror crash, and Christian Horner's emotional farewell.

items.title: 'I had doubts it would ever happen' - McIlroy opens up on Grand Slam glory
items.summary: Rory McIlroy has admitted he feared he may never win The Masters before he completed the career Grand Slam during the 'best year' of his golfing career.

items.title: Australia's Cummins and Lyon out of fourth Ashes Test in Melbourne
items.summary: Australia captain Pat Cummins has been rested for the fourth Ashes Test against England as his back issue is managed, while the injured Nathan Lyon has been replaced by fellow off-spinner Todd Murphy for the game in Melbourne.
